bunpro.writeup: けど is one of the common conjunction particles in Japanese. These are particles that function by connecting the (A) and (B) parts of a sentence. けど works very similarly to が , in that it highlights 'while thinking about (A), (B)'. This means that けど will often come across as 'but' in English.As can be seen from these examples, just like many other grammatical constructions, だ will be required when using けど after a な-Adjective , or a noun.けど is just a modern (casual) version of けれども . Please see below for a list of the most casual, to the most formal variations.Casual - けど - けども - けれど - けれども - が - Formal.CautionThe phrase after けど will often be omitted if it is obvious, or the speaker does not want to say it.

examples.japanese: パソコンはないけど。(大丈夫?)
examples.english: I don't have a computer… (but is that okay?)

examples.japanese: その赤いTシャツが好きだけど、青いTシャツを買う。
examples.english: I like that red T-shirt, but I will buy the blue one.

examples.japanese: 毎日シャワーを浴びるけど、今日は浴びない。
examples.english: I take a shower every day, but today I will not.

examples.japanese: お金があるけど、買いません。
examples.english: I have money, but I won't buy (it).

examples.japanese: 豚肉は嫌いだけど、鶏肉は食べます。
examples.english: I don't like pork, but I eat chicken.

false_friends.meaning: Even so, However, Even though, But
